summary: Satellite navigation encompasses the use of geostationary satellites and global navigation satellite systems (GNSS) to provide precise positioning and timing information. In the EU context, regulatory frameworks such as the Galileo system and the European Geostationary Navigation Overlay Service (EGNOS) enhance navigational safety, particularly in aeronautical and maritime domains. The European Space Agency (ESA), through its ESTEC facility in Noordwijk, evaluates satellite technologies and develops systems like Cospas-Sarsat for distress locator beacons. These initiatives aim to refine eSafety measures and improve collision avoidance through advanced radar and AIS systems, ensuring seamless communication across airspace and seagoing vessels.
